comment: Lack of support, unclear expectations, and no empathy for emergencies made this class extremely stressful. Essays lacked guidance, and the open-book tests were unhelpful unless you had transcripts. Despite improving my grades, I still got a B. Not a supportive or fair professor.

Whatever you do, DO NOT take this prof. She's a tough grader, which already sucks, but she also rarely (if ever) gives guidelines for grading. If you want to improve your grade, good luck. I once got a B on an exam and received no feedback whatsoever. How am I supposed to improve? It's like she just doesn't like giving A's or something.  No way.

She has some bad reviews but I've honestly enjoyed this class. I like how she does the weekly modules and that I can work at my own pace. The weekly quizzes are not timed and are open-note, so the textbook can be used. The exams are hard. The first half is multiple-choice but the second half is essay questions. She is a tough grader too.

It's like nothing will satisfy Emily. Exams are open book but we can't rephrase what we read, if we put information in our own words it's not “specific” enough, if we rephrase other sources outside of the book material, it's “cheating”. My classmates and I have reached out for help and instead of her teaching properly, she's vague. Avoid this one.

Definitely one of, if not the worst, professors I've ever had. She is extremely fussy with grading and does not offer any remotely helpful feedback when you reach out. Her recorded weekly lectures are very surface level and point out irrelevant details that don't add much to the context of the time period. Overall a frustrating class.

This is a very obnoxious professor. Dumps too much essay writing and useless information, which is overwhelming. Note taking barely helps for the 3 exams you have to take because she doesn't tell you what's important to write and what isn't. She doesn't believe in study guides and is very vague in helping students who are reaching out for help.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: This is your warning, this professor is easily the worst prof. I have had since beginning college. Her lectures are only pictures, no notes to take, and 3 videos a week on average. You must read the textbook to understand anything because her teaching style is nonexistent. She has 3 exams that are 2 parts with MC and essay questions. 0/10.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Do not take this class unless you are able to write notes and read extremely fast!!! She has lecture videos with no bullets, only very fast talking over pictures, and you HAVE to read the textbook to do well. Multiple choice test questions will pull specific details from the textbook and lectures. Tests also have 2 essays and 2 short answers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: DO NOT take unless you can teach yourself. Only materials were the textbook and audio of her talking very fast over pictures. Awful for taking notes. Tests are open book but TIMED. You'll be scrambling to find details with the search tool, and writing is impossible to finish in 140 minutes. 3 separate paragraphs, plus not one, but 2 ESSAYS per test

Absolutely DO NOT take this professor! You spend all of your time reading hundreds of pages and watching hours and hours of lectures/videos each week. Her method of teaching is literally throwing as much information as possible at you and expecting you to memorize it. There are no assignments, just quizzes and exams with required essay sections.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Test heavy
